support.pleaseFieldsAll: Bitte f√ºllen Sie alle Felder aus
support.failedSendEmailRetry: Support-E-Mail konnte nicht gesendet werden. Bitte versuchen Sie es sp√§ter erneut.
support.faqUpgradePlan: Wie kann ich meinen Plan upgraden?
support.faqUpgradePlanAnswer: Gehen Sie zu Einstellungen > Abonnement, um verf√ºgbare Pl√§ne anzusehen und zu aktualisieren. Sie k√∂nnen je nach Ihren Speicherbed√ºrfnissen zwischen den Pl√§nen Pers√∂nlich, Familie oder Professionell w√§hlen.
support.faqDataSecurityAnswer: Your data is encrypted with military-grade post-quantum encryption (Kyber-1024 + AES-256-GCM). Your encryption keys are generated on your device and never leave it unencrypted. Even SeraVault cannot access your data.
support.faqShareFiles: Kann ich Dateien mit Nicht-Benutzern teilen?
support.faqShareFilesAnswer: Currently, file sharing is only available between SeraVault users. You can invite others to join SeraVault, and once they create an account, you can share files securely with them.
support.faqForgotPassphrase: Was passiert, wenn ich meine Passphrase vergesse?
support.faqForgotPassphraseAnswer: Your passphrase is the only way to decrypt your data. If you forget it, your data cannot be recovered. We recommend setting up hardware key authentication as a backup method, or storing your passphrase in a secure password manager.
support.faqCancelSubscription: How do I cancel my subscription?
support.faqCancelSubscriptionAnswer: Go to Settings > Subscription and click "Cancel Subscription". Your subscription will remain active until the end of your billing period, after which you'll be downgraded to the free plan.
support.faqFileTypesAnswer: SeraVault supports all file types including documents (PDF, DOCX, TXT), images (JPG, PNG, GIF), videos, and encrypted forms. Maximum file size depends on your subscription plan.
support.supportPageSubtitle: Get help from our support team
support.subscribersOnlyAlert: E-Mail-Support ist verf√ºgbar f√ºr Benutzer mit einem aktiven Abonnement (Pers√∂nlich, Familie oder Professionell Plan). Wir antworten in der Regel innerhalb von 24-48 Stunden.
support.messageSentDetails: You will receive a confirmation email shortly. We'll respond to your request within 24-48 hours.

security.title: Post-Quanten-Kryptographie
security.subtitle: Milit√§rische Verschl√ºsselung, die vor Quantencomputer-Angriffen sch√ºtzt
security.quantumResistantBadge: SeraVault verwendet quantenresistente ML-KEM-768 (NIST FIPS 203) Verschl√ºsselung
security.quantumThreatIntro: Quantencomputer stellen eine existenzielle Bedrohung f√ºr aktuelle Verschl√ºsselungsstandards dar. Traditionelle Verschl√ºsselungsmethoden wie RSA und ECC werden obsolet, sobald gro√ü angelegte Quantencomputer in Betrieb sind.
security.quantumThreatDesc: SeraVault employs cutting-edge post-quantum cryptographic algorithms approved by NIST (National Institute of Standards and Technology) to ensure your data remains secure both now and in the quantum computing era.
security.aesgcm256Desc: Advanced symmetric encryption for data at rest
security.hkdfSha512Desc: Key derivation for secure key management
security.encryptionAtRestDesc: Every file you store is encrypted client-side using quantum-resistant algorithms before being sent to our servers.
security.encryptionAtRestStep1: Your passphrase derives a master key using HKDF-SHA512
security.encryptionAtRestStep2: Each file gets a unique AES-256-GCM key
security.encryptionAtRestStep4: All encryption happens in your browser - we never see your keys
security.encryptionInTransitDesc: When sharing files with contacts, we use ML-KEM-768 for quantum-resistant key exchange.
security.encryptionInTransitStep1: Recipient's public key is used with ML-KEM-768
security.encryptionInTransitStep2: Shared secret is derived from encapsulated key
security.encryptionInTransitStep3: File key is encrypted with the shared secret
security.encryptionInTransitStep4: Only the intended recipient can decrypt
security.zeroKnowledgeArchDesc: We can't access your data even if we wanted to. Your passphrase never leaves your device, and all encryption/decryption happens client-side.
security.unlockedTooltip: üîì Private key unlocked ‚Ä¢ {{minutes}} minutes remaining ‚Ä¢ Keys auto-expire for security
security.lockedTooltip: üîí Private key is locked ‚Ä¢ Click to unlock and access encrypted files
security.zeroKnowledgeStep1: Passphrase stays in your browser memory
security.zeroKnowledgeStep2: Private keys are encrypted with your passphrase
security.zeroKnowledgeStep4: We cannot decrypt your files or see your content
security.hardwareKeyDesc: For maximum security, you can use a hardware security key (like YubiKey) to protect your master passphrase.
security.hardwareKeyStep1: Store your passphrase on a FIDO2 hardware key
security.hardwareKeyStep3: Protected against phishing and remote attacks
security.hardwareKeyStep4: Works across devices with the same key
security.quantumResistantDesc: Approved by NIST for post-quantum security
security.zeroKnowledgeDesc: We never have access to your unencrypted data
security.forwardSecrecyDesc: Each file uses unique encryption keys
security.hipaa: HIPAA - Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act (for medical forms)
security.pwaUpdatesDesc: SeraVault automatically checks for updates every 60 seconds and will refresh when a new version is available.
security.forceClearCacheDesc: If you're experiencing issues, you can manually clear all cached data and service workers. This will reload the application with a fresh copy.
security.disclaimer: Security is a shared responsibility. While we provide military-grade encryption, always use strong passphrases, enable hardware key protection when possible, and keep your devices secure.

profile.title: Profil
profile.keyManagementDescription: Sichern und verwalten Sie Ihre Verschl√ºsselungsschl√ºssel
profile.deleteWarning: Once you delete your account, there is no going back. All your data will be permanently deleted.
profile.hardwareKeyInfo: You're using hardware key authentication. Your private key is stored securely on your device and not protected by a passphrase. You can still download your decrypted key for backup purposes.
profile.downloadKeyBackupDesc: Downloads a JSON file containing your encrypted private key. Safe to store as backup.
profile.notAvailableHardwareKey: Not available when using hardware key authentication only.
profile.downloadDecryptedKeyWarning: ‚ö†Ô∏è Downloads your private key in plain text.
profile.downloadDecryptedKeySecurityRisk: Only use if you understand the security risks.
profile.downloadDecryptedKeyBackup: Use this to backup your key when using hardware authentication.
profile.changePassphraseDesc: Update the passphrase used to encrypt your private key.
profile.unlockKeyRequired: To download your decrypted private key, you must first unlock your key using your passphrase, biometric authentication, or key file.
profile.passphraseChangedSuccess: ‚úÖ Passphrase changed successfully! Use your new passphrase the next time you unlock your keys.
profile.keysGeneratedOnDevice: Your keys are generated on YOUR device
profile.keysNeverSentUnencrypted: they never travel to our servers unencrypted. This ensures maximum security and privacy.
profile.needUpdatedKeys: Your account needs updated post-quantum secure keys. Please regenerate your key pair with a strong passphrase.
profile.generateKeysIntro: To secure your documents, you need to generate a post-quantum secure key pair. Please enter a display name and choose your preferred key storage method below.
profile.strongPassphraseWarning: Your passphrase is the ONLY way to decrypt your private key. If you lose it, your data cannot be recovered.
profile.optionalBackupPassphraseDesc: With hardware key storage, you can optionally also set a passphrase as a backup method. This allows you to access your files even if you don't have your hardware key with you.
profile.useHardwareKeyStorage: Use Hardware Key for Storage (Recommended if available)
profile.hardwareKeyStorageDesc: Store your private key on a hardware security key (like YubiKey). This is the most secure option as your key never leaves the physical device.
profile.biometricNotSupported: Biometric authentication is not supported on this device or browser.
profile.biometricDescription: Use your device's built-in biometric authentication (fingerprint, face recognition) to unlock your encryption keys.
profile.hardwareKeysNotSupportedDesc: Your browser doesn't support WebAuthn/FIDO2, which is required for hardware security keys. Please use a modern browser like Chrome, Firefox, Edge, or Safari.
profile.hardwareSecurityKeysDesc: Use physical security keys (like YubiKey) to protect your encryption keys. Your private key is stored securely on the hardware device.
profile.noKeysRegisteredDesc: Register a hardware security key to add an extra layer of protection to your account.
profile.touchKey: Touch your security key when prompted
profile.optionalBackupPassphraseHelper: Optional: Set a backup passphrase to access files without your hardware key
profile.recommendedBackupAccess: Recommended: Provides backup access if hardware key is unavailable
profile.hardwareKeysCannotBeCopied: Hardware keys cannot be copied or cloned.
profile.hardwareKeyLossWithPassphrase: If you lose all your hardware keys AND forget your backup passphrase, you will permanently lose access to your files. We strongly recommend registering at least one additional backup hardware key in Profile ‚Üí Security.
profile.hardwareKeyLossWithoutPassphrase: Without a backup passphrase, losing your only hardware key means permanent data loss. We strongly recommend registering additional backup hardware keys immediately after signup (Profile ‚Üí Security ‚Üí Hardware Keys) while you still have access to this hardware key.
profile.standardModeDesc: Your private key will be encrypted with your passphrase and stored on our servers. You can add hardware key authentication later in your profile settings.
profile.generateKeysAndSetupHardware: Generate Keys & Set Up Hardware Key
profile.biometricSecurityNote: Your private key is encrypted with your biometric data and stored locally. Biometric authentication only works on this device and cannot be transferred to other devices.
profile.dualAuthenticationDesc: You have both passphrase protection and hardware keys set up. You can unlock using either method. For maximum security, you can remove the passphrase-protected copy from our servers if you have multiple backup hardware keys.
profile.addSecurityKeyDesc: Add a security key to enable phishing-resistant two-factor authentication
profile.howItWorksStep1: Insert your security key (USB, NFC, or Bluetooth) or use device biometrics
profile.howItWorksStep2: Touch the key when your browser prompts you
profile.howItWorksStep3: The key will be registered and can be used for authentication
profile.howItWorksStep4: Store your private key in the hardware for maximum security (no passphrase needed, but requires backup keys)
profile.authenticationMethodsDesc: Manage how you sign in to your account. We recommend having at least two methods for account recovery.
profile.addBackupAuthMethodDesc: You're currently using phone authentication only. Add email and password as a backup in case you lose access to your phone number.
profile.updateEmailInfo: A verification email will be sent to your new address. You'll need to click the link to complete the change.
profile.updatePhoneNumberInfo: You'll need to verify your new phone number with an SMS code.
profile.verificationEmailSent: Verification email sent! Please check your new email address and click the link to complete the change.
profile.validEmailRequired: Please enter a valid email address
profile.newPasswordMinLength: New password must be at least 8 characters
profile.newPasswordMustDiffer: New password must be different from current password
profile.emailAlreadyInUse: This email is already registered. Please use a different email.
profile.weakPasswordError: New password is too weak. Use at least 8 characters with mixed case, numbers, and symbols.
profile.requiresRecentLogin: For security, please sign out and sign in again before updating your email.
profile.requiresRecentLoginPassword: For security, please sign out and sign in again before updating your password.
profile.providerAlreadyLinked: Email/password authentication is already linked to this account.
profile.passwordMinLength: Password must be at least 8 characters
profile.phoneBackupExplanation: After verifying your phone number, you'll set up an email and password as a backup authentication method. This ensures you can always access your account even if you lose your phone number.
profile.backupAuthDescription: Create an email and password to secure your account. You'll be able to sign in with either your phone number or email.
profile.hardwareSecurityKeyDesc: Physical USB, NFC, or Bluetooth security key (e.g., YubiKey, Titan Key)
profile.passkeyDesc: Built-in fingerprint, face recognition, or device PIN
profile.giveSecurityKeyNickname: Give your security key a nickname to help you identify it later.
profile.givePasskeyNickname: Give your passkey a nickname to help you identify it later.
profile.privateKeyStoredInHardware: Your encryption private key will be stored inside the hardware key. No passphrase needed! Your private key never touches our servers.
profile.privateKeyStoredInPasskey: Your encryption private key will be stored inside the passkey. No passphrase needed! Your private key never touches our servers.
profile.privateKeyNotAvailableDesc: You must unlock your private key with your passphrase before registering a hardware key. The hardware key stores your private key locally for future unlocks.
profile.hardwareBackupWarning: After registration, you'll be prompted to remove the passphrase-protected key from the server. We strongly recommend having at least 2-3 hardware keys registered before doing so. Losing your only hardware key would mean permanent data loss!
profile.deviceBackupWarning: After registration, you'll be prompted to remove the passphrase-protected key from the server. We strongly recommend having at least 2-3 hardware keys registered before doing so. Losing your only device would mean permanent data loss!
profile.pleaseTouchSecurityKey: Please insert and touch your security key...
profile.pleaseAuthenticateDevice: Please authenticate using your device (fingerprint, face, or PIN)...
profile.unlockMethodsDesc: Richten Sie verschiedene M√∂glichkeiten zum Entsperren Ihrer verschl√ºsselten Daten ein. Sie k√∂nnen Passphrasen, Ger√§tbiometrie oder physische Sicherheitsschl√ºssel verwenden.
profile.quickBiometricDesc: Speichern Sie Ihren verschl√ºsselten Schl√ºssel nur lokal auf diesem Ger√§t. Verwenden Sie Fingerabdruck oder Face ID, um schnell zu entsperren, ohne Ihre Passphrase einzugeben. Dies ist ger√§tespezifisch und wird nicht synchronisiert.
profile.keyManagementWarning: Verwalten Sie Ihre Verschl√ºsselungsschl√ºssel sorgf√§ltig. Der Verlust des Zugriffs auf Ihre Schl√ºssel bedeutet dauerhaften Datenverlust.
profile.restorePassphraseDesc: Create a passphrase to encrypt your private key. This allows you to unlock your account using either your hardware key or your passphrase.
profile.passphraseProtectsPrivateKey: Your passphrase protects your private key. Use 12+ characters with a mix of words, numbers, and symbols.
profile.importDataDesc: Elemente aus JSON importieren oder exportierte Daten aus einer ZIP-Datei wiederherstellen.
profile.importItemsDesc: Elemente aus einer JSON-Datei importieren. Unterst√ºtzte Typen: "account" (Passw√∂rter), "note" (sichere Notizen), "credit_card" (Kreditkarten) und "key" (Krypto-Schl√ºssel).
profile.1passwordFormatDesc: Aus 1Password als JSON exportieren (1pux-Format nicht unterst√ºtzt)
profile.lastpassFormatDesc: Aus LastPass als JSON exportieren (CSV nicht unterst√ºtzt)
profile.importExportedDesc: Dateien aus einer ZIP-Datei wiederherstellen, die aus der Gefahrenzone exportiert wurde. Die exportierten Dateien sind entschl√ºsselt und werden w√§hrend des Imports mit Ihrer Passphrase erneut verschl√ºsselt.
profile.importInProgress: Import l√§uft. M√∂chten Sie wirklich gehen?
profile.invalidFileType: Bitte w√§hlen Sie eine ZIP-Datei aus
profile.failedToImportExport: Fehler beim Importieren der exportierten Daten

stripeRedirect.title: Weiterleitung zu Stripe
stripeRedirect.leavingSeraVault: Sie verlassen SeraVault und werden zum sicheren Zahlungsportal von Stripe weitergeleitet.
stripeRedirect.enhancedSecurityDesc: Die PCI-konforme Infrastruktur von Stripe stellt sicher, dass Ihre Zahlungsdaten mit Sicherheit auf Bankniveau gesch√ºtzt sind.
stripeRedirect.noThirdPartyDesc: Wir sehen oder speichern niemals Ihre Zahlungsinformationen - sie werden vollst√§ndig von Stripe verarbeitet.
stripeRedirect.industryStandardDesc: Stripe betreibt Zahlungen f√ºr Millionen von Unternehmen weltweit, einschlie√ülich Fortune-500-Unternehmen.
stripeRedirect.reducedAttackDesc: Indem wir Zahlungsdaten nicht direkt verarbeiten, minimieren wir Sicherheitsrisiken f√ºr Ihr Konto.
stripeRedirect.pwaNote: Hinweis: Bei der Weiterleitung m√ºssen Sie m√∂glicherweise nach Abschluss der Zahlung manuell zur App zur√ºckkehren. Suchen Sie nach dem SeraVault-Symbol in Ihrer App-√úbersicht oder auf dem Startbildschirm.
stripeRedirect.browserNote: Hinweis: Nach Abschluss der Zahlung bei Stripe werden Sie automatisch zur√ºck zu SeraVault weitergeleitet.

cleanup.title: Speicherwartung
cleanup.description: Bereinigen Sie verwaiste Anh√§nge und geben Sie Speicherplatz frei.
cleanup.loginRequired: Sie m√ºssen angemeldet sein, um die Bereinigungsprogramme zu verwenden.
cleanup.orphanedDescription: Finden und entfernen Sie Anhangsdateien, die keinem Formular mehr zugeordnet sind. Dies kann passieren, wenn Formulare gel√∂scht wurden, bevor die automatische Bereinigung implementiert wurde.
cleanup.privateKeyRequired: Ihr privater Schl√ºssel ist erforderlich, um Formularanh√§nge zu scannen. Bitte entsperren Sie zuerst Ihren Tresor.
cleanup.noOrphanedFound: Keine verwaisten Anh√§nge gefunden. Ihr Speicher ist sauber!

cleanup.failedToDelete: {{count}} Datei(en) konnten nicht gel√∂scht werden. √úberpr√ºfen Sie die Konsole f√ºr Details.
